comment: Prof. Grooms is funny, engaging, helpful, and has an amazingly melodious voice. The assignments he gave were challenging in all the right ways, but not too hard. He's a published author, and therefore very qualified to teach the class. I wish there'd been a higher writing standard, but it was an intro class, so it was fine. Would take again.
Grooms is anything but boring. The material was engaging which made time fly. I enjoyed the class and would take another course with him if I wasn't about to graduate. Take Grooms!!!

I am very on-the-fence about Grooms. On the one hand... he was very interesting to listen to when speaking about the class. He was not however, very helpful when it came to the research project a the end of the class. He did not really care if we participated or not in class. I was interested in the material, however the class was sort of 'meh'

Everyone here took him for lower level classes, but take him for upper level and you will hate yourself. He will do anything to give you a lower grade than you should get and his definition of a "response" is still unclear to me to this day. Lectures are beyond boring and like pulling teeth because of how dull the material is.

Professor Grooms has the magic vocal combination of Morgan Freeman and Barry White, which at times can hurt him a little bit. His lectures are very long winded, and at times it comes across as him just listening to his own voice. For a writing class (this being the 4th that I've taken) it was pretty garden-variety. Workshops weren't very helpful.
Great professor. Show up to class, do the readings and assignments and you will do great! I enjoyed his class

The whole semester we spent all our time preparing for a project due at the end of the year.  Unclear on directions for assignments. Will surprise you with the grade at the end then makes himself unavailable due to a "business trip" Very monotone and boring.

THE EASIEST CLASS I'VE EVER TAKEN! I read nothing. Not one thing and got an A in the class. He explains everything in class and gives you all the questions and answers before the final. He gave two other assignments that were very easy. He also cancelled our last paper and gave us all 100s (25% of our grade). And he is a very nice guy! TAKE HIM!!!

If you're a literary history nerd, you'll absolutely love this class. It's very interesting if you keep an open mind, but some find the material boring. He gave two assignments and a test. Grades fairly, is very kind, and willing to help. By *FAR* my favorite English professor I've ever had. Hands down. Take him!
Prof Grooms is the best fiction-writing teacher you could hope for at KSU.
Nice guy and willing to work with you on your papers. He talks for ever and it gets boring at times but his grading is fair.

Grooms is a thorough and engaging professor who will go out of his way to provide the information you're seeking. His reviews of your work are thoughtful and constructive without being demeaning (no matter how bad your work is!)
SUPER NICE GUY!  Class is terribly boring sometimes but worth it since all the test are take home and writing assignments are easy. Take him if you can!
Prof. Grooms is a really nice guy, his class was really boring but he hardly gives any assignments and is willing to help you. Overall pretty easy class.

Prof. Grooms is very nice, but a little long winded at times.  He provides a lot of insight to the art of writing prose.  I found the workshop part of the class to be the most fun and informative.  Because of the nature of the class, there aren't very many assignments, which frees up more time to write or focus on other classes.
